diamonds.title: Round Brilliant Diamond
diamonds.note: Round Brilliant diamonds are precision cut with 57–58 facets to maximize fire and brilliance. This is the most popular and investment-stable diamond cut worldwide, offering exceptional light performance and timeless appeal.

diamonds.title: Oval Cut Diamond
diamonds.note: Oval diamonds combine round brilliance with elongated elegance, creating the illusion of greater size per carat while maintaining strong sparkle and graceful proportions.

diamonds.title: Emerald Cut Diamond
diamonds.note: Emerald cut diamonds feature long step facets that emphasize clarity and symmetry, producing an elegant hall-of-mirrors effect preferred by collectors and connoisseurs.

diamonds.title: Pear Shape Diamond
diamonds.note: Pear diamonds blend round brilliance with marquise elegance, forming graceful tear-drop silhouettes ideal for statement pendants and artistic ring designs.

diamonds.title: Marquise Cut Diamond
diamonds.note: Marquise diamonds maximize surface area and visual size, delivering bold elongated brilliance that enhances finger length and dramatic luxury aesthetics.

diamonds.title: Princess Cut Diamond
diamonds.note: Princess cut diamonds offer intense brilliance with sharp square geometry, making them highly popular for contemporary engagement and bridal jewellery.

diamonds.title: Radiant Cut Diamond
diamonds.note: Radiant diamonds combine brilliant and step facets, offering exceptional sparkle while maintaining strong rectangular or square geometry.

diamonds.title: Cushion Cut Diamond
diamonds.note: Cushion cut diamonds feature rounded corners and large facets that produce soft romantic brilliance with timeless vintage charm.

sapphires.title: Cornflower Blue Sapphire
sapphires.note: Cornflower blue sapphires are prized for their soft, velvety blue tone with high transparency. Stones from Sri Lanka are considered among the most elegant and desirable in the sapphire market.

sapphires.title: Royal Blue Sapphire
sapphires.note: Royal blue sapphires exhibit deep saturated blue with excellent brilliance, making them highly popular for premium jewellery collections.

sapphires.title: Deep Blue Sapphire
sapphires.note: Madagascar sapphires are known for their strong saturation and excellent crystal clarity, offering deep luxurious blue tones at premium quality.

sapphires.title: Kashmir Type Blue Sapphire
sapphires.note: Kashmir-type sapphires are valued for their soft velvety texture and rich blue hue, historically considered the finest sapphire color in the world.

sapphires.title: Pear Cut Blue Sapphire
sapphires.note: Pear-shaped sapphires offer graceful brilliance, combining round sparkle with elongated elegance ideal for luxury pendants.

sapphires.title: Pink Sapphire
sapphires.note: Pink sapphires display vibrant romantic hues and excellent durability, making them popular for engagement and contemporary designs.

sapphires.title: Purple Sapphire
sapphires.note: Purple sapphires offer rare hues ranging from lavender to royal violet, perfect for exclusive bespoke jewellery.

sapphires.title: Lavender Sapphire
sapphires.note: Lavender sapphires are admired for their soft pastel tones that complement modern minimalist jewellery designs.

sapphires.title: Padparadscha Sapphire
sapphires.note: Padparadscha sapphires are extremely rare, displaying a delicate lotus-flower pink-orange hue, highly prized by collectors.

sapphires.title: Parti Color Sapphire
sapphires.note: Parti sapphires naturally show multiple colors within one stone, making each gem completely unique and highly artistic.

sapphires.title: Orange Sapphire
sapphires.note: Orange sapphires provide warm vibrant color tones ideal for bold modern jewellery styles.

sapphires.title: Yellow Sapphire (Pukhraj)
sapphires.note: Yellow sapphires are widely used in astrology and premium jewellery, valued for their bright golden color and durability.

sapphires.title: Green Sapphire
sapphires.note: Green sapphires offer earthy luxury tones and exceptional hardness, making them excellent for everyday luxury jewellery.

sapphires.title: Emerald Cut Green Sapphire
sapphires.note: Emerald-cut green sapphires showcase crystal clarity and structured geometry ideal for premium statement jewellery.

sapphires.title: Teal Sapphire
sapphires.note: Teal sapphires blend blue and green hues, offering highly fashionable tones loved in custom engagement rings.

sapphires.title: Teal Sapphire Radiant Cut
sapphires.note: Radiant cut teal sapphires offer intense brilliance combined with fashionable color blending.

sapphires.title: White Sapphire
sapphires.note: White sapphires provide diamond-like appearance with excellent durability at more accessible pricing.

sapphires.title: Star Blue Sapphire
sapphires.note: Star sapphires display a rare six-rayed star due to rutile inclusions, making them prized collector and astrological stones.

sapphires.title: Cabochon Blue Sapphire
sapphires.note: Cabochon sapphires are polished smooth to emphasize natural body color and are commonly used in traditional gemstone jewellery.

sapphires.title: Emerald Cut Navy Blue Sapphire
sapphires.note: Navy blue sapphires in emerald cuts deliver bold depth of color with elegant architectural facet patterns.

rubies.title: Pigeon Blood Ruby
rubies.note: Pigeon Blood rubies are the rarest and most valuable rubies in the world, prized for their intense red hue with slight blue undertone and exceptional brilliance.

rubies.title: Burmese Ruby
rubies.note: Untreated Burmese rubies are extremely rare and highly sought after for their natural crystal structure and historic prestige.

rubies.title: Burmese Round Ruby
rubies.note: Round Burmese rubies provide balanced brilliance and strong color saturation ideal for timeless jewellery settings.

rubies.title: Mozambique Ruby
rubies.note: Mozambique rubies are known for their excellent clarity and vivid red tones, offering exceptional beauty and value.

rubies.title: Madagascar Ruby
rubies.note: Madagascar rubies offer strong color with excellent transparency, suitable for both collectors and fine jewellery.

rubies.title: Heated Ruby
rubies.note: Heat-treated rubies enhance clarity and color stability while maintaining natural gemstone composition.

rubies.title: Untreated Ruby
rubies.note: Untreated rubies preserve their original crystal structure and natural beauty, highly valued by gemstone purists.

rubies.title: Pear Cut Ruby
rubies.note: Pear cut rubies combine brilliance with elegant elongated shape, ideal for statement pendants.

rubies.title: Emerald Cut Ruby
rubies.note: Emerald cut rubies highlight internal crystal character and produce elegant step reflections.

rubies.title: Marquise Ruby
rubies.note: Marquise rubies offer dramatic visual size and elongated brilliance for bold jewellery designs.

rubies.title: Heart Cut Ruby
rubies.note: Heart-shaped rubies symbolize love and passion, popular for bespoke jewellery pieces.

rubies.title: Star Ruby
rubies.note: Star rubies display a natural asterism effect caused by rutile inclusions, forming a six-rayed star under direct light.

emeralds.title: Colombian Emerald
emeralds.note: Colombian emeralds are considered the finest in the world, known for their intense green color and classic jardin inclusions that prove natural origin.

emeralds.title: Zambian Emerald
emeralds.note: Zambian emeralds offer slightly bluish-green tones with excellent transparency and durability compared to other origins.

emeralds.title: Brazilian Emerald
emeralds.note: Brazilian emeralds typically display lighter green hues with attractive brilliance and softer saturation.

emeralds.title: Pear Cut Emerald
emeralds.note: Pear shaped emeralds combine brilliance with elegant drop silhouettes ideal for statement pendants.

emeralds.title: Round Emerald
emeralds.note: Round emeralds are uncommon due to cutting challenges and are valued for balanced symmetry and brightness.

emeralds.title: Cabochon Emerald
emeralds.note: Cabochon emeralds highlight color over brilliance and are favored in classic and antique jewellery designs.

emeralds.title: Vintage Cut Emerald
emeralds.note: Vintage cuts emphasize large facets and deeper body color, offering old-world elegance preferred by collectors.

emeralds.title: Light Green Emerald
emeralds.note: Light green emeralds provide softer tones suitable for everyday fine jewellery at accessible price points.

emeralds.title: Deep Green Emerald
emeralds.note: Dark green emeralds from Zambia show strong saturation and excellent durability for premium jewellery settings.

emeralds.title: Investment Grade Emerald
emeralds.note: Top grade Colombian emeralds with minimal treatment are considered long-term appreciating assets among gemstone investors.
